summary: The Security Council, recalling previous resolutions and statements on Côte d'Ivoire, reaffirms its commitment to the country's sovereignty, independence, territorial integrity, and unity. It notes the Secretary-General's report of 4 December 2006 and reaffirms support to impartial forces, namely UNOCI and French forces. The Council expresses serious concern at the crisis and humanitarian consequences in Côte d'Ivoire, determining the situation continues to pose a threat to international peace and security. Acting under Chapter VII, it decides to extend the mandate of UNOCI and French forces until 10 January 2007 and remains actively seized of the matter.
